707597f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 38th St. E.
707597f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, from 40th to 38th Streets, showing the
New York Edison Company power houses.
October 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712441f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 1st Avenue
712441f-a.text:
38th Street, weat from east of First Avenue, showing the New
York Edison power house at the right, and a new building (about
1929) at the N.W. corner of First Avenue.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REP(ODUCTIONS.

712443f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 1st Avenue
712443f-a.text:
38th Street, west from but not including First Avenue.
April 8, 1V31.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712445f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 1st Avenue
712445f-a.text:
38th Street, north side, west from No. 325 between First and
Second Avenues.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712442f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712442f-a.text:
East 38th Street, south side, west from First Ave. The gasoline
station shown in the foreground, is at the S.W. corner of First Ave. Also
shown is the Second Ave. Elevated Line.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712444f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712444f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, west from First Avenue, showing mainly the
southerly side of this thoroughfare. Running diagonally thru
the corner property at the left are the tubes of the Queens
Midtown tunnel. The former tenements standing at this site were
demolished in 1929 to make way for a gsOline station and which
in time was razed for the present improvement in April 1938. The
adjoining buildings will follow in the Fall of 1939. To the
right is the Eleto Co. warehouse, housing the delivery services of
''1United Parcels''. This structure was erectend in late 1928.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New Yorl City Tunnel Authority
CREDIT LINE IEPERATIVE

712446f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712446f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, north side, east from Second to Birst
Avenues, showing at the various coners (left to right) the
16 story apartment house (W'o. 30l E), the Eleto Co. Warehouse
and the Consolidated Edison Co. power house.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

712448f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712448f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, north side, west from (Wo. 315, right) a
point between First and Second Avenues, and acroso the latter.
At the P. E. corner of Second Avenue appewrs a lb story apartment
house (No. 301 E. ) erected in 1928. Across the Avenue, and
midway between Third, is the J. C. G. Hupel's Brewery. The
shadowy portion above same is the upper part of the office structure
known as No. 1O E. 4Oth Street.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel A.thority
CREDIT LINE IMP6ATiV

707595f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 38th St. E.
707595f-a.text:
(1)
Filling station and 657 First Avenue, at and adjoining the
south west corner of 38th Street.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, and showing a further view southward to East 35th
Street.
April a, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707595f-b.text:
(1)
Filling station and 657 First Avenue, at and adjoining the
south west corner of 38th Street.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, and showing a further view southward to East 35th

712447f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712447f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, south side, west from (No. 316 left) a point
between First and Second Avenue and to the latter. Note the
political signs at the left indicating the Congressional 1938
struggle between incuribent John J. C'Connor and the successful can-
sdidate JJames H, Fay. This contest had national attention because
of Adminstration interest. The name of Israel Amter indicates the
Communist party's candidate for Governor of the State of New York.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York -ity Tunnel Authority
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

712440f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 1st Avenue
712440f-a.text:
38th Street, north side, west from and including First Avenue,
also showing the S.W. corner, where the building shown is
shortly to be demolished.
March 23, 1928.
L. Sperr.  P.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
